title: Sell Douglas Laing Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Douglas Laing Whisky | XOP & Director's Cut | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Douglas Laing whisky. We buy XOP (Xtra Old Particular), Old Particular, and Director's Cut releases.
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for XOP, Director's Cut, and Old Particular.
introParagraph: Douglas Laing & Co. focuses on artisan, small-batch Scotch. Their XOP (Xtra Old Particular) range represents the crown jewels of their inventory.
conditionFactors: XOP Box: Comes in a premium wooden box with a certificate. Must be complete.
Label: Old Particular labels distinguish by color (Green for grain, Red for malt).
Seal: Wax dipped XOP bottles need crack inspection.
Director's Cut: An older series, highly prized.
pricingFactors: Series: XOP is the top tier. Director's Cut is the legacy top tier.
Distillery: Islay distilleries (Laphroaig, Caol Ila) in XOP format trade highest.
Age: 30+ year old single grains in Clan Denny or Old Particular are good value.
Vintage: Specific birth-year vintages carry premiums.

faqs.question: What is XOP?
faqs.answer: Xtra Old Particular. It replaced the 'Old & Rare' series for Douglas Laing after the company split.

faqs.question: Do you buy Big Peat?
faqs.answer: We buy the 'Christmas Edition' (Cask Strength) and aged limited releases (e.g., 33 Year Old).

faqs.question: What happened to Old Malt Cask?
faqs.answer: That brand went to Hunter Laing. Douglas Laing created 'Old Particular' to replace it.

faqs.question: Do you buy Provenance?
faqs.answer: Only older vintages or specific closed distilleries. Current releases are too common.

faqs.question: Is Clan Denny valuable?
faqs.answer: Aged single grains (40+ years) are definitely collectible.
